Name: Coin
Description: Copper alloy coin, with on one side the head of a ruler, and on the other the image of a temple in Greco-Roman style, with pediment supported by two columns. The surface is quite worn, and it is broken away on one side. In the absence of archaeological context, its interest lies in the date of acquisition, as part of the collection of antiquities formed by Lady Harriet Kavanagh. Her collection with its inventory provides a rare example of a well-documented private group of materials from the 1840s.
